intro: Pedicularis bulbosa, commonly known as the bulbous lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a tuberous root system, which allows it to survive in harsh alpine environments. Its leaves are typically basal and lance-shaped, while its stems are often hairy and branched. Pedicularis bulbosa is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic relationships with other plants.
